content.description:
Scramble up to a ledge, where you can clip the second bolt. The third bolt can be a bit awkward to clip. From there, the route traverses up and right on underclings and positive holds to join the other two routes at the last lead bolt. Climb the roof to the anchors.

This route is still exfoliating, but it has interesting moves.
content.location: This is the leftmost line at the crag.

content.description:
This route starts with one bolt on the right side below the ledge then 3 more independent bolts before joining the other routes at the last lead bolt and mounting the shared roof to a two bolt anchor. It seems holds have broken on this as the crux was crumbly and felt much harder than

Ghost

, 5.12, to the left. Getting to the second bolt above the ledge has significant ledgefall potential.
content.protection: 5 bolts ending at a [now double] bolt anchor. You can bring a 0.5 for the ledge break, but it is not needed.
content.location: It is furthest to the right below the ledge.

content.description: Start with 5.8 climbing past two bolts to a ledge. After the ledge, the bouldery and dynamic crux is a bit "spooky" with the ledge right below. Then it eases up a bit before it joins the other two routes at this crag and mounts the shared roof to a now double bolt anchor.
content.protection: 6 bolts ending at a [now double] bolt anchor.
content.location: Start on the left side below the ledge, in between the two other routes here.
